title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned after opting out of his Red Sox deal, despite a strong 2025 season.
Garrett Crochet expresses surprise at Giolito's free agent status given his value in the pitching market.
Red Sox added Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, reducing chances of Giolito re-signing with the team.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr. and Bears WR DJ Moore are potential trade targets for the New England Patriots.
Jaguars OL Walker Little and Seahawks EDGE Uchenna Nwosu are also considered trade candidates for the Patriots.
Patriots may target Jaguars WR Brian Thomas Jr. due to his big-play potential despite a recent underwhelming season.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a five-on-five scrimmage at Celtics practice but remains without a set return date.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla emphasized the importance of Tatum's full recovery, without committing to a specific return timeline.
Tatum's practice with the G League's Maine Celtics and a recent documentary teaser have fueled speculation of a near return.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports commentators use minimal commentary during pivotal Olympic moments, emphasizing silence as a tool.
Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered restrained calls for Team USA's 2-1 hockey victory over Canada.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir limit commentary during Alysa Liu's gold-winning figure skating performance.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free bus rides on routes 23, 28, and 29 through June, using leftover federal COVID-19 funds.
Free bus program covers Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury, aiding connections to key Orange Line stations.
Mayor Wu explores future funding with state officials, continues discussions with MBTA on sustaining fare-free service.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow total in Massachusetts with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches by Saturday morning.
Essex County towns like Haverhill and Methuen experienced snow accumulations of up to 5 inches.
The National Weather Service warned of a high-impact storm with blizzard conditions expected from Sunday night into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa draws inspiration from her coworker Annie, a veteran marathon runner, to achieve her lifelong running goal.
The event on April 20, 2026, holds significant personal and commemorative meaning for LaRosa.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, of Pembroke, was sentenced to 15 months in prison for wire fraud involving COVID-19 relief funds.
He misappropriated over $1 million in Economic Injury Disaster Loans, using $600,000 to buy Angus Lea Golf Course.
Kirouac's actions included undisclosed financial transactions and certification misuse to obtain pandemic relief funds.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with stealing over $9,000 worth of merchandise from high-end Boston stores, including Lululemon and Ralph Lauren.
Cutelis faces multiple charges, including larceny and drug possession, with a legal designation as a 'common and notorious thief'.
Bail set at $2,500; Cutelis held without bail on a fugitive charge for failing to appear in New Hampshire court.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will continue as the Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, per manager Alex Cora.
Anthony displayed a strong rookie season, hitting .336 with six home runs and 17 RBIs in the leadoff spot.
Boston's projected lineup includes Anthony leadoff, Willson Contreras cleanup, potentially Trevor Story second, providing balance.
